title: 'I Wish There Was An Easy Ending:' Afghanistan's Murky Future After Longest U.S. War
description:
President Biden announced this week that all U.S. troops if Afghanistan will be withdrawn by Sept. 11, marking the end of America's 20-year war there.

Former U.S. Army Col. Christopher Kolenda tells NPR there is "no easy ending" to American involvement in Afghanistan.

Roya Rahmani, Afghanistan's ambassador to the U.S., tells NPR Afghan civilians will continue to face daily threats of violence.

In participating regions, you'll also hear from local journalists about what's happening in your community.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: 'I Wish There Was An Easy Ending:' Afghanistan's Murky Future After Longest U.S. War
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: American troops are leaving Afghanistan after 20 years, sparking concern that conditions in the country could deteriorate.
itunes:subtitle: American troops are leaving Afghanistan after 20 years, sparking concern that conditions in the country could deteriorate.
